modifiers.text: This week was so much fun!
I loved learning in {X} this week.
I really enjoyed the content this week.
I had fun this week.
I'm really enjoying the module content.
I'm like a kid in a candy store, but the candy is knowledge.
Learning in {X} is my new favorite hobby, second only to procrastinating.
I'm on a knowledge binge and I can't stop.
Learning in {X} is my new cardio, it gets my heart pumping and my mind racing.
I'm like a detective, solving the mysteries of the universe one fact at a time.
I'm so excited to learn, I can hardly contain myself.
{X} is like a treasure hunt, and I'm the Indiana Jones of knowledge.
I'm having so much fun learning, I almost forgot it's supposed to be boring.
I'm on a knowledge high and I can't come down.
I'm having a blast, I can't believe this is actually called 'studying'
I'm having so much fun in {X}, I think I might just become a professional student.
This week was good.
I am enjoying {X} right now.
I feel like I've hit the jackpot with this module.
This is better than a day at the beach.
Who needs a holiday when you have {X}?
I'm learning and feeling so alive.
I'm like a sponge, soaking up all this knowledge and enjoying every moment.
I feel like I'm on a treasure hunt and every answer I find is just so exciting.
I'm enjoying every moment and learning all sorts of cool things.
Who needs a good book when you can have lessons like this?
I'm optimistic that with enough studying, I'll become a genius... or at least pass the exam.
I'm hopeful that one day, all this information will click and make sense.
I'm confident that with enough learning, I'll be able to understand my lecturer when they talk.
I'm hopeful that one day, I'll be able to have a conversation about {X} without saying 'I have no idea what you're talking about'
I am feeling optimistic about {X} this week.
I think that this week went well.
Things are looking up for me in {X}.
I think I am going to do well in {X}.
I have faith that I'll understand...someday.
I'm optimistic that I'll learn...assuming the world doesn't end first.
I have a can-do attitude...even if I can't do it right now.
I have a positive outlook...that I'll figure it out.
I'm so optimistic, I believe I can learn anything...eventually.
I have a growth mindset and believe I can learn anything.
Every new lesson is an opportunity for growth and progress.
I have faith that my efforts will pay off and I will achieve my goals.
I look forward to each new challenge and the opportunity to grow.
I am filled with optimism and eagerness to learn.
I see every setback as a step forward in my learning journey.
I trust that my education will teach me how to procrastinate effectively.
I'm confident that I'll finally be able to tell my left from my right.
I have faith that this time, I won't fall asleep in class.
I'm ready to put in the hard work, because the easier it is, the less I'll learn.
I'm optimistic, because what's the worst that could happen? I'll end up with a PhD in cat videos.
I'll keep trying, even if it takes me forever... or a miracle.
My brain is like a sponge, but instead of water, it's soaking up information.
Learning is my superpower and I'm ready to flex my brain muscle.
I'm a nerd and I'm not afraid to embrace it.
I'm a brainiac and I'm loving every minute of it.
Learning is like a game, and I'm all in to win.
I'm so proud, I'm thinking about getting a tattoo of a brain to commemorate my newfound knowledge.
I'm so proud, I'm considering changing my name to 'Professor' for the rest of my life
I'm so proud, I'm thinking about starting a blog to share my newfound knowledge with the world.
I'm so proud, I'm considering becoming a walking encyclopedia, ready to spout out facts at any moment.
I am proud of what I achieved this week.
I did well this week.
I am proud of myself for achieving my goals in {X} this week.
I am proud of sticking it out this week.
I am proud of how well I did this week.
I've uncovered the mystery...it was hiding under a rock.
I'm a master of the obvious...finally.
I've unlocked the secrets of the universe...or just this one thing.
It's like a lightbulb finally went on for me...after a long period of loadshedding.
I'm on fire! I feel like I'm learning faster than I can write it down.
My brain is officially in overdrive, and I'm loving it.
I'm a learning machine, and I'm not slowing down.
I'm starting to feel like a genius, but let's not get ahead of ourselves.
I'm officially a trivia master, or at least in my own mind.
I'm feeling smarter by the minute, and it's a pretty good feeling.
I think I'm going to have to invest in a bigger brain soon.
I'm starting to feel like I have superpowers, and I blame it on my learning.
I'm starting to think that I'm a learning addict, and I'm okay with that.
I'm feeling proud, smart, and a little bit dangerous with all this newfound knowledge.
I am frustrated with the pace of learning.
I am angry about the complexity of the material in {X}.
I am irritated by {X} this week.
I am annoyed at myself for not doing more this week.
I am frustrated with the content this week.
I'm so angry, I could throw a textbook across the room.
I'm so mad, I could make a meme about it.
I'm feeling a bit annoyed at {X} at the moment.
I am frustrated with myself this week.
I could have done better in {X} this week.
Learning and I have a love-hate relationship, and lately it's been more hate.
{X} is making me more irritated than a cat in a bathtub.
I feel like I'm playing a game of Angry Birds, but with knowledge.
I feel like I'm a computer trying to process a big data file.
Learning in {X} is like trying to find a needle in a haystack, with only your toes.
I'm more frustrated than a cat trying to catch a laser pointer.
Argh!
Saying that I am annoyed at {X} right now is putting it lightly.
I should be better.
When will {X} end?!
I am so annoyed about {X} this week.
I feel like I'm stuck in an endless loop of frustration.
This week I am more frustrated at {X} than I am at loadshedding.
{X} this week is as annoying as realising there's a bug in your code.
I felt a bit anxious this week.
I was a bit stressed this week.
I was a bit nervous about {X}.
I was anxious, but I handled it well.
I was stressed, but I handled it well.
{X} was stressful this week.
I could have done more to deal with my stress.
Stress. Stress everywhere.
Can open, worms everywhere.
I'm "fine".
I need chocolate!
I need a hug!
I'm not anxious. You're anxious.
What if I told you that I'm a bit nervous?
It was a rough week.
The anxiety was real, yoh!
I didn't handle my stress well.
I was super anxious about {X}.
I'm about an 11 out of 10 on the anxiety scale right now.
Wow, things got real this week.
I was anxious, but only a bit.
I'm just a brain on the brink of a breakdown!
Learning in {X} is like trying to solve a Rubik's Cube blindfolded.
I am concerned about falling behind in {X}.
I think I'm just going to curl up in a ball and hide.
I think I need a vacation from this stress.
I'm feeling more stress than a cat in a room full of rocking chairs.
I'm more stressed than a squirrel in traffic.
I'm starting to feel like a nervous wrecking ball.
{X} is giving me more anxiety than a clown at a phobia convention.
I feel like I'm trying to climb Mount Everest with flip flops.
I'm starting to feel like a hamster on a wheel of confusion.
I'm feeling more pressure than a balloon at a darts tournament.
I'm more tense than a tightrope walker in a tornado.
There are many topics I am unsure of.
I have a few questions.
There are some things I don't understand well enough, but don't tell anyone else that.
I am worried about not being good enough in {X}.
I feel like an imposter in {X}.
I'm so ashamed, I could hide under a rock... or just admit I didn't study.
I feel like I am not learning as fast as others.
Imposters gotta impost.
Well, at least I know what I need to work on now.
I may not be the brightest bulb in the box, but at least I'm trying.
I am worried that others will think I am stupid in {X}.
I feel like a snail when it comes to learning in {X}.
I feel ashamed about not knowing stuff in {X}.
Feeling ashamed in {X} is like being stuck with a permanent red face emoji.
It feels like everyone else knows more than I do in {X}.
I wish I caught on faster.
I think I just hit my shame quota for the year.
I'm pretty sure I just set a new low score record in {X}.
At least I tried... and failed spectacularly.
I think I just stumbled upon a new talent... failing tests.
At least I got to practice my handwriting during the test.
I have questions, but I am scared to ask them.
Feeling ashamed is like a permanent state of being for me in {X}.
I am good at pretending to know what is going on in {X}.
I feel like I'm trying to drink from a fire hose of information.
I think my brain is going to implode from all this new knowledge.
I'm pretty sure my brain just short-circuited from all this studying.
My brain is about to overload from all this new information.
Things could be worse. They could also be better.
I am feeling overwhelmed and unsure this week.
I am not sure that I'll be able to pass {X}.
I'm so hopeless, I'm considering becoming a beach bum instead of finishing {X}.
I'm convinced that I'll never understand this material, I'm ready to give up and join a cult.
I'm so hopeless, I'm considering becoming a hermit and just living off berries and roots.
I'm ready to throw in the towel and just become a professional napper instead of studying.
I'm so hopeless, I'm thinking about becoming a street performer and just guessing the answers.
I'm so hopeless, I'm considering becoming a meme and just existing on the internet forever.
I wish that banging my head against the table actually worked.
I just need to make it through this week.
I could use a motivational poster around about now.
I just can't seem to get it, no matter how hard I try.
I'm tired of trying and failing.
I'm losing hope that I'll ever understand this subject.
I feel like I've hit a wall and can't move forward.
I don't think I'll ever be able to master this.
I'm just so frustrated and discouraged with my learning process.
I have a tendency to forget things, including why I started learning in the first place.
I think I need a learning intervention.
I feel like I'm always one step behind, but hey, I'm making progress... right?
I have a hard time retaining information, but I make up for it with my charm.
I'm not giving up, I'm just... regrouping.
I'm not giving up, just taking a break for the semester.
Meh!
I was bored with the content this week.
I wish the content was more interesting.
I lost interest a bit.
This week was super boring!
Learning in {X} this week was like watching paint dry, but less exciting.
I'm pretty sure my brain is in hibernation mode from all this boredom.
I'd rather watch grass grow than sit through another video.
My brain is so bored, it's starting to play solitaire with itself.
I'm convinced that learning in {X} is just a fancy way of saying 'sitting around being bored'.
I'm so bored, I think I just became an expert in the art of doodling.
This week's content almost put me to sleep.
I'm counting the minutes until this module is over.
This is the definition of mind-numbingly boring.
I can feel my IQ dropping by the minute.
This week's content was the epitome of dull and uninteresting.
I'm just going through the motions here.
I felt like I was in a Boring Learning Simulator this week.
I think I'd rather watch grass grow...in reverse.
I'd rather clean my room with a toothbrush than learn in {X}.
I'm tempted to run out of the room just to escape the boredom.
Who needs a nap when you can sit through this?
I'm just so grateful for the opportunity to be this bored.
Who needs TV when you can have lessons like this?
This is like a dream come true...a nightmare, that is.
I'm on the edge of my seat, literally dying of excitement.
I feel like I'm on a never-ending joy ride...into the depths of boredom.
I'm having so much fun, I can't wait to forget everything I just learned.
